item.title: Nagarjunakonda: A Glimpse into Ancient Buddhist History
item.description:
Introduction

Nagarjunakonda, a historically significant site nestled in the Nalgonda district of Andhra Pradesh, India, is a treasure trove of Buddhist history and architectural marvels. Situated on an island in the Nagarjunasagar reservoir formed by the Nagarjunasagar Dam, the location is a testament to the rich heritage of the Ikshvaku dynasty, who ruled the region in the 3rd century CE. Though not located in Vijayapura, the site is a significant archaeological and historical attraction, attracting visitors from across the globe. The elevation of the area is relatively low, characteristic of the Deccan Plateau region. Itâ€™s located close to Vijayawada, a major city in Andhra Pradesh, making it accessible for both domestic and international travelers. The unique charm of Nagarjunakonda lies in its beautifully preserved ruins, excavated Buddhist sites, and the serene environment created by its island setting in the sprawling reservoir.
